business.headline: GST buying bonanza kicks off, cars lead the wayPM Narendra Modi described GST 2.0 as "a reform dedicated to the people of India," and for many, the benefits were felt immediately.

Is your income tax refund less than Rs 10,000? Here's why it might reach you fasterMany taxpayers are frustrated with refund delays. But here's the catch, simpler refunds tend to move more quickly through the system than bigger claims.

Festive season stock picks: Which sectors are the best bet right now?Autos have already seen a sharp rally, while consumer durables, FMCG, PSU banks, and infrastructure are also emerging as areas to watch.

Sensex and Nifty end flat as IT losses offset consumer stock gainsThe S&P BSE Sensex slipped 11.83 points to 82,102.1, while the NSE Nifty50 settled 32.85 points lower at 25,169.50. The broader small- and mid-cap indices also lagged, declining 0.5% and 0.4%, respectively.

Indian-origin Srinivas Gopalan, Rahul Goyal appointed as CEOs of two big US companiesTwo major US companies have appointed Indian-origin CEOs. Telecom giant T-Mobile announced Srinivasan Gopalan will take over as CEO from November 1. Beverage major Molson Coors has chosen Rahul Goyal as its new CEO, effective October 1. Gopalan's appointment comes as the US wireless market faces challenges, including slowing subscriber growth and fierce competition. Goyal, a company veteran, has previously served in key roles including CFO of Molson Coors India. These appointments are notable amidst discussions around the H1B visa program in the US. A reporter noted, "Desi CEO for US Giants is the biggest news in the day for Telecom and IT space as well." This highlights the significance of these leadership changes in the corporate world.

Gold rises to all-time high. 3 reasons behind its strengthInvestors are flocking to gold as it climbs to record highs, supported by currency weakness, economic uncertainty, and inflationary pressures. Here are the three main drivers.

Denied, delayed, dismissed: Inside India's broken health insurance systemIn this special report, part of our 'CLAIM DENIED' series, we uncover why health insurance in India has become a gamble for families.

SIP vs SWP: How to turn your retirement corpus into reliable incomeAccumulating wealth through SIPs is just the beginning of retirement planning. The real challenge is turning that corpus into a steady income. Here's how you can do it.

PF pre-retirement withdrawal rules likely to be relaxed: ReportAt present, EPFO members can withdraw their entire corpus only after reaching the retirement age of 58, or if they remain unemployed for more than two months.

Launching a startup? This government scheme simplifies early fundingStarting a startup is exciting but securing funds at the initial stage is often a hurdle. This government scheme provides seed funding through incubators, giving you the financial boost to test, prototype, and launch your product.

ITR-5 and ITR-7 filing opens online. Who can file and by when?The Income Tax Department has opened online filing for ITR-5 and ITR-7 forms for AY 2025–26. These forms are not meant for individuals but for specific entities. Here's a quick look at who needs to file and the deadlines.

Who is Srini Gopalan, T-Mobile's new Indian-origin CEOSrini Gopalan will take over from Mike Sievert, who has been named Vice Chairman. Mike Sievert, the outgoing CEO, said that Gopalan was the natural choice to take T-Mobile forward.

entertainment.headline: This silver is gold: Suhana, Aryan's sweet note for papa SRK's National Award winSuhana Khan and Aryan Khan posted a sweet message for their father Shah Rukh Khan after he received the National Film Award for Best Actor for 'Jawan'.

Actor Suriya's security officer duped of Rs 42 lakh by his domestic help's familyActor Suriya's PSO was cheated of Rs 42 lakh by his domestic help's family. The scam has wider implications as police uncover a Rs 2 crore fraud racket in Chennai.

Real fear is within: Vidhu Vinod Chopra on 12th Fail's National Award winDirector Vidhu Vinod Chopra's film '12th Fail', depicting Manoj Kumar Sharma's inspiring rise from poverty to the IPS, won a National Award in New Delhi. The filmmaker, in an exclusive interview with AajTak, emphasised that his cinema is about truth and inner conviction, hoping audiences engage deeply with his work.

Poonam Pandey removed from Mandodari role in Delhi Ramlila amid objectionsThe Luv Kush Ramlila Committee has removed actor Poonam Pandey from playing Mandodari at Delhi's Red Fort after facing objections from political and religious groups. The committee said the decision was made to ensure the event's core purpose of spreading Lord Ram's message is upheld.

Rani Mukerji wears necklace with daughter Adira's initials at National Awards. PicRani Mukerji won the Best Actress award at the 71st National Film Awards for 'Mrs Chatterjee vs Norway' and added a personal touch to her look with a gold chain featuring her daughter Adira's initials.

Exclusive: Homebound Oscar selection sparks rule debate, FFI chairman responds'Homebound' has been selected as India's official entry for the Oscars 2026. The decision sparked debate over the film's theatrical release and screening timeline compliance.

Janaawar OTT: When and where to watch Bhuvan Arora's crime seriesBhuvan Arora leads 'Janaawar – The Beast Within', a gritty crime drama about a tribal sub-inspector drawn into a dangerous investigation of murder, greed, and betrayal. The series premieres on ZEE5 on September 26, following the trailer launch on September 8.

Allu Arjun heaps praise on Teja Sajja's Mirai, calls it technical brillianceTeja Sajja's 'Mirai' has emerged as a box-office success, earning praise from industry mains including Allu Arjun, for its passion, scale, and technical excellence. With global collections crossing Rs 100 crore and continuous fan support, the film is set to enjoy a strong theatrical run ahead.

Cinema is the heartbeat of my soul: Mohanlal after Dadasaheb Phalke winMohanlal accepted the Dadasaheb Phalke Award at the 71st National Awards with a stirring speech, calling the honour "not a dream-come-true but something sacred," and dedicating it to Malayalam cinema and its legendary fore-runners.

When Katrina Kaif reflected on childhood and her hopes as a future motherKatrina Kaif shared her thoughts on fatherhood, the absence of a father figure during her upbringing, and her hopes for her future children. The actor and her husband Vicky Kaushal are expecting their first child.

Aryan Khan nails star power in The Ba***ds of Bollywood with no wasted cameosAryan Khan's directorial debut with 'The Ba***ds of Bollywood' shines with 21 Bollywood cameos, sharp storytelling, and a vision that proves he's more than just Shah Rukh Khan's son.

KBC 17: Amitabh Bachchan recalls time when wife Jaya played host on the showOn 'Kaun Banega Crorepati 17', Big B shared Navratri greetings and welcomed contestant Pallavi Niphadkar. Bachchan recalled an episode where his wife Jaya hosted, and he became the contestant, describing himself as speechless.

Mastiii 4 teaser: OG trio Vivek, Riteish, Aftab promise four times laughter and funThe teaser of 'Mastiii 4' starring Vivek Oberoi, Aftab Shivdasani and Riteish Deshmukh is out. The film is slated to release in theatres on November 21.

Parineeti Chopra back on YouTube with baby bump and life updates. WatchActor Parineeti Chopra on Tuesday announced her YouTube comeback eight months after starting her channel. The latest video featured the actor exploring different ideas and genres for her channel and reacting to viral memes, while giving a baby bump update.

Nana Patekar offers support to Pak shelling victims, provides Rs 42 lakh aidActor Nana Patekar's Nirmala Gajanan Foundation, in collaboration with the Indian Army, distributed Rs 42 lakh rehabilitation aid to 117 families affected by cross-border shelling in Rajouri and Poonch in the aftermath of Operation Sindoor. Patekar called it a collective responsibility of citizens.

Kumar Sanu's ex-wife Rita alleges abuse during pregnancy: They locked kitchenKumar Sanu's ex-wife, Rita Bhattacharya, alleged that she faced abuse from the singer and his family while pregnant with their son, Jaan Kumar Sanu. She also claimed his behaviour changed after he gained fame with 'Aashiqui', and highlighted instances of mistreatment and neglect during their marriage.

Samantha and rumoured boyfriend Raj Nidimoru hit the gym together in MumbaiSamantha Ruth Prabhu and Raj Nidimoru were seen together at a Bandra gym in Mumbai. Their joint appearance has fuelled ongoing rumours about their relationship.

Taylor Swift has intruder arrested at Travis Kelce's house over Justin Baldoni caseTaylor Swift faced a security incident at fiance Travis Kelce's house after a man was arrested for trespassing. The man was attempting to serve legal documents related to a lawsuit involving actor Justin Baldoni.

Karan Johar's joke on Farah Khan's cook Dilip steals spotlight at Homebound premiereKaran Johar and Farah Khan's witty banter stole the spotlight at the Mumbai premiere of Neeraj Ghaywan's 'Homebound', even amid a star-studded turnout.

general news.headline: I ended 7 unendable wars including India and Pak: Trump at UN General AssemblyAt the UN General Assembly session, US President Donald Trump repeated his claim that he had a hand in solving the military flare-up between India and Pakistan.

US govt proposes new H-1B visa system, favours high-skilled, high-waged workersThe Trump administration's H-1B visa overhaul, prioritising high-skilled, well-paid workers, follows a hefty $100,000 fee hike. Aimed at curbing the visa programme's alleged misuse, the move has sparked a debate about whether it would really protect American jobs or drive talent abroad.

Record rain brings Kolkata to knees; 10 dead, 91 flights cancelledKolkata reels under record rainfall, with streets and homes submerged, and ten dead in rain-related incidents. Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee said authorities were working round the clock to restore normalcy amid widespread flooding and disrupted festive preparations.

Trump claims London 'wants Sharia law', renews attack on Mayor Sadiq KhanUS President Donald Trump told the UN General Assembly that London "wants to go to sharia law" under its "terrible mayor." A spokesperson for Mayor Sadiq Khan hit back, calling the remarks "appalling and bigoted".

How India destroyed Pakistan in sign-language warIndia's dominance over mujahid mentality-infested Pakistan spans both the battlefield and cricket field. It has turned Pakistani provocations into opportunities to assert control. From Operation Sindoor to Arshdeep Singh's viral on-field gesture, India's evidence-backed strikes and measured retorts on the field have left Pakistan outplayed in every arena.

Jaffar Express derails after blast in Pak's Balochistan, rescue ops underwayThe incident occurred just hours after Pakistani security forces clearing railway tracks in the same area were targeted with explosives.

Everything closed for you: Macron, stopped for Trump convoy, dials US PresidentAs Macron was returning to the French embassy after his UN speech, he was stopped by the New York police to let US President Donald Trump's convoy pass. Read on to find out what unfolded later.

Mamata Banerjee to inaugurate Durga Puja pandals virtually amid Kolkata rain woesWest Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee will inaugurate Durga Puja pandals virtually after heavy rains and flooding crippled Kolkata, leaving nine dead and disrupting flights and transport.

Exclusive: Homebound Oscar selection sparks rule debate, FFI chairman responds'Homebound' has been selected as India's official entry for the Oscars 2026. The decision sparked debate over the film's theatrical release and screening timeline compliance.

India, China funding Ukraine war: Trump slams Russian oil purchase in UN speechDonald Trump told delegates that Russia's ongoing offensive was being propped up by revenue from energy sales. He directly named India and China, saying their imports were financing Moscow's campaign.
ULIPs & Mutual Funds: Why you need both for a balanced portfolioULIPs give you protection and discipline for the long haul, while mutual funds give you liquidity and flexibility for the near term.

Husband fails to consummate marriage, wife seeks Rs 2 crore compensationA marital dispute escalated in Bengaluru after a wife allegedly demanded Rs 2 crore over unconsummated relations, with the husband claiming assault by her family and filing a police complaint.

This silver is gold: Suhana, Aryan's sweet note for papa SRK's National Award winSuhana Khan and Aryan Khan posted a sweet message for their father Shah Rukh Khan after he received the National Film Award for Best Actor for 'Jawan'.

Bad escalator, bad teleprompter: Trump sums up his UN visitWhen Donald Trump took the podium at the General Assembly, his teleprompter malfunctioned at the very start, prompting him to deliver his remarks without it.

Patna gears up for CWC meet with Rahul Gandhi, Mallikarjun Kharge in attendanceThe extended CWC meeting at Sadaqat Ashram follows Rahul Gandhi's 1,300-km 'Voter Adhikar Yatra' and aims to consolidate the party's momentum ahead of the Bihar assembly elections. Later, Gandhi will launch the Atipichhda Nyay Sankalp initiative at Hotel Chanakya.

A car full of booze and an unlikely HC ruling on caste. What's the connection?What began as a liquor smuggling case in Uttar Pradesh turned into a deeper judicial reflection on caste. A High Court judge used the moment to question why caste still features in police records and public life.

Aryan Khan's 'Ba***ds of Bollywood' revels in film industry idiosyncrasies, tropesAryan Khan's directorial debut doesn't proclaim a star is born, but it certainly shows he is an observant filmmaker who loves his entertainment loud and big

He is putting one hell of a fight: Trump praises Zelenskyy during New York meetThis marked the fourth meeting between the two leaders since Trump returned to office in January. Their discussions come as tensions rise between Nato and Moscow following a string of Russian aerial incursions into allied airspace.

A Siddaramaiah appeal to Wipro's Azim Premji amid Bengaluru's traffic troublesKarnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah wrote to Wipro founder Azim Premji to allow limited vehicular movement through the campus, aiming to ease traffic on Bengaluru's Outer Ring Road.
Why beauty burnout is on the riseFeeling tired of your skincare routine, like it's more of a chore than a treat? You could be experiencing beauty burnout. Here's how to reset and enjoy it again.
Why India must climate-proof its highways, and fastThe monsoon this year has been an infrastructure resilience crisis, bringing the weakness of India's tenuous road network to a head

Denied, delayed, dismissed: Inside India's broken health insurance systemIn this special report, part of our 'CLAIM DENIED' series, we uncover why health insurance in India has become a gamble for families.

Asia Cup: Arshdeep Singh's response to Haris Rauf's fighter-jet celebration goes viralIndia's Arshdeep Singh made headlines with a fiery gesture which could likely have come during the game against Pakistan in the Asia Cup 2025.

sports.headline: Pakistan bounce back to hammer Sri Lanka, stay alive in final raceAsia Cup 2025: Pakistan overcame Sri Lanka in a tense and nervy chase to secure valuable points in the Super Four stage of the Asia Cup. After a disciplined bowling show, Pakistan chased down a 133-run target in just 18 overs in Dubai on Tuesday, September 23.

ICC suspends USA cricket body over governance issuesThe International Cricket Council has suspended USA Cricket membership citing governance failures and reputational damage. The ICC will oversee US teams and guide reforms to protect cricket's future in the country.

After war of celebrations, Hasaranga hugs it out with Pakistan's Abrar AhmedWanindu Hasaranga and Abrar Ahmed lit up the Asia Cup 2025 Super 4 clash on Tuesday with a playful duel of wickets and imitations, turning a tense low-scoring game into box-office theatre.

No rest in Asia Cup, Jasprit Bumrah likely to be picked for West Indies TestsAsia Cup 2025: On the eve of India's Super Four match against Bangladesh in Dubai, assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate hinted that Jasprit Bumrah will be included in the Test squad for the upcoming two-match series against the West Indies, starting on 2 October in Ahmedabad.

Shreyas Iyer requests break from red-ball cricket ahead of West Indies Tests: ReportShreyas Iyer has reportedly requested a break from red-ball cricket, writing to the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) to ask that he not be considered for Test matches for the time being, according to news agency PTI.

Watch: Pakistan's Abrar Ahmed gives Wanindu Hasaranga a dose of own medicineAsia Cup 2025, PAK vs SL: Pakistan spinner Abrar Ahmed added a fun twist to the Super 4 clash against Sri Lanka by imitating Wanindu Hasaranga's signature celebration after dismissing him.

Delighted how India carried themselves despite Pakistan provocation: Assistant coachAsia Cup 2025: India's assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate praised the players' composure for not reacting to provocative gestures from Pakistan players during their heated Super 4 match. The former Dutch captain also shed light on Jasprit Bumrah's performances and Sanju Samson's show in the tournament.

Sanju Samson gets backing from team management despite tough start to new roleAsia Cup 2025: Assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate said the team management is backing Sanju Samson to find his rhythm in the middle-order. Samson struggled to get going against Pakistan in the Super 4 match in Dubai on Sunday.

England announce Ashes squad: Harry Brook named vice-captain, Mark Wood returnsBen Stokes, Mark Wood and Jofra Archer have been named in England's Ashes squad as they continue their injury comebacks, while Chris Woakes misses out ahead of the November series in Australia.

Saw what Haris Rauf did: India coach responds to fighter-jet gesture controversyIndia assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate praises the team's calm response to Haris Rauf's provocative gestures during Asia Cup 2025. India beat Pakistan by six wickets in the Super 4 fixture of the tournament in Dubai.

It has turned Pakistani provocations into opportunities to assert control. From Operation Sindoor to Arshdeep Singh's viral on-field gesture, India's evidence-backed strikes and measured retorts on the field have left Pakistan outplayed in every arena.

The former Dutch captain also shed light on Jasprit Bumrah's performances and Sanju Samson's show in the tournament.

Sanju Samson gets backing from team management despite tough start to new roleAsia Cup 2025: Assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate said the team management is backing Sanju Samson to find his rhythm in the middle-order. Samson struggled to get going against Pakistan in the Super 4 match in Dubai on Sunday.

England announce Ashes squad: Harry Brook named vice-captain, Mark Wood returnsBen Stokes, Mark Wood and Jofra Archer have been named in England's Ashes squad as they continue their injury comebacks, while Chris Woakes misses out ahead of the November series in Australia.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
